description: <div>UMD 3.2.1 is the third update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).</div>
releaseNotes: <div>This release contains the following products:</div><br><div><b>EMI Technology Provider:</b></div><br><div>Storage Management:</div><br><div>Storm 1.11.2 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>This new Storm release provides &nbsp;the bug fixes and improvements for the StoRM services (Backend, Frontend, GridHTTPs and YAIM). This version also present the new functionality were StoRM GridHTTPs server doesn't need to request a TURL from the BE during transfer requests.</li></ul></div>
installationNotes: All products in the UMD 3.2.1 release were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the documentation links) to support 64 bit Scientific Linux 5 and Scientific Linux 6 (x86_64 processor architecture). Some products are also supported in 64 bit Debian 6 (squeeze). &nbsp;Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.
contact: For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the EGI Helpdesk to make a report.
knownIssues: <div>Details containing known issues and workarounds found in EGI verification and staged rollout are collected in:&nbsp;<a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-3:UMD-3.2.1">https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-3:UMD-3.2.1</a></div>
changeLog: <div>This releases includes updates for the following products:</div><div><ul><li>Storm&nbsp;<br></li></ul></div>

products.name: emi.storm
products.description: StoRM (STOrage Resource Manager) is a storage manager service (SRM) for generic disk based storage system, compliant with the standard SRM interface version 2.2. StoRM provides data management capabilities in a Grid environment to share, access and transfer data among heterogeneous and geographically distributed data centres.In particular, StoRM works on each POSIX filesystems (ext3, ext4, xfs, basically on everything than can be mounted on a Linux machine) but it also brings in Grid the advantages of high performance storage systems based on cluster file system ( such as GPFS from IBM or Lustre from Sun Microsystems ) supporting direct access (native POSIX I/O call) to shared files and directories, as well as other standard Grid access protocols. StoRM is adopted in the context of WLCG computational Grid framework.
products.releaseNotes:
StoRM Backend v. 1.11.2
